preqs: Twelve credit points of second-year Arts units.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACL2%, AEH2%, AMU2%, ASA2%, ATS2%, AZA2%} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ACL2005, ACL299%, AEH299%, AMU299%, ASA2331, ASA299%, ATS2208, ATS2296, ATS2297, ATS2344, ATS2386, ATS2387, ATS2394, ATS2612, ATS2713, ATS2957, ATS299%, AZA2423, AZA299%, MON2003})

unitName: The music business: How to be successful in the music industry
description: This unit examines fundamental concepts and business practices of the Australian music industry, focusing on the practical knowledge and transferable skills required to commence and maintain a professional career in the music industry. It explores the interaction of music and culture mediated through business institutions and includes an introduction to self-management, copyright, record companies and the recording process. Attention is paid to the Australian music industry and some comparison with overseas practices is made.
